variable.name: SUBJID
variable.description: Subject ID - collection site ID (called SiteSubjID in phenotypic files) consisting of Site (not used for SGI collection, 2 digits for MGS1 collection, and 3 digits for MGS2 collection), Family (5 digits for SGI collection, and 4 digits for MGS1 or MGS2 collections) and Individual_within_family (5 digits for SGI collection, and 3 digits for MGS1 or MGS2 collections) with hyphens between the 2-3 elements for the cases and parents; OR consisting of Site (3 digits, always 150) and Individual (5 digits) with hyphens between the 2 elements for the controls

variable.name: SAMP_SOURCE
variable.comment: All from RUCDR (Rutgers University Cell and DNA Repository)

variable.name: SOURCE_SAMPID
variable.description: Sample ID used in the Source Repository
variable.comment: Also known as DNA_ID, the ID number assigned by the RUCDR to this subject's DNA specimens

variable.name: SAMP_SOURCE2
variable.description: Genotyping set (in this cases nonGAIN, as opposed to previous GAIN_EA and GAIN_AA done in the same collection study on diffferent samples)

variable.name: SOURCE_SAMPID2
variable.description: Sample ID - also called nonGAIN_ID (in subject file)

variable.name: SAMP_SOURCE3
variable.description: Genotyping set (in this cases nonGAIN, as opposed to previous GAIN_EA and GAIN_AA done in the same collection study on diffferent samples)

variable.name: SOURCE_SAMPID3
variable.description: Intraplate duplicate sample for QC purposes
variable.comment: Five-digit number followed by ".dup" (blank if no duplicate sample)

variable.name: SAMP_SOURCE4
variable.description: Genotyping set (in this cases nonGAIN, as opposed to previous GAIN_EA and GAIN_AA done in the same collection study on diffferent samples)

variable.name: SOURCE_SAMPID4
variable.description: DupSAMPID, written as NG-5 digit number.dup
variable.comment: "NG-" followed by 5-digit number followed by ".dup" (blank if no duplicate sample)
